title: You're twitch, an enemy flashed away with 15 health and full stacks of true damage.

replies.body:
if they had 15hp, and potioned they should die at max stacks of his passive.
even at the lowest lvl max stacks still deals 70~ dmg.

Lets see, a Champion at 15hp, -12hp a second for 6 second (72 true damage over 6 second, 72/6 = 12), +10hp for 15 seconds from health potion (150 healing over 15 seconds, 150/15 = 10).
Time in seconds since Poison
1: 13hp (15 - 12 + 10)
2: 11hp (13 - 12 + 10)
3: 9hp (11 - 12 + 10)
4: 7hp (9 - 12 + 10)
5: 5hp (7 - 12 + 10)
6: 3hp (5 - 12 + 10)
DoT ends and champion survives.

Answer: Pots OP.

I'm sorry let me rephrase.  All stages of the game unless you're Dr. Mundo, Swain, Vladimir, Twitch, Volibear, Fizz, or Singed.  Point is that Twitch's passive is great for picking off fleeing champions.  It does need to scale better in the late game, but even in its current damage amount it's not just "regeneration countering".  76 true damage over 6 seconds is 13 true damage per second (rounded up).  No champion regenerates that much.  Sure, it can be healed, and shielded, and lifesteal back up, but passive regeneration?  Not even Mundo running x2 recovery, spirit visage, and warmogs can pull that.  He needs to ult before that damage becomes ignorable.

Yeah, aaing someone once is just regeneration cancelling, but that goes with all AD carries with on hit effects, it's not that awesome unless you stack it (I'm looking at you titty princess {{champion:21}}).

I do want you to know it deals way more than that. Dealing 6 true damage per second, up to 6, so you got up to 36 over this and after 6 seconds it would (or should) deal 216 damage. BUT, the other person has health regen, so whatever you shoot out, subtract it from the health regen. So if the enemy has from 2 to 3 (maybe even 4) health regen every second, it'd bring down his damage per second to 4 or 3 damage per second, so at max, it would deal (instead) 24 or 18 each second. After 6 seconds, it would deal up to 144 or 108 damage over the seconds. And, there are other reasons for his/her survival. Imagine if a healing support showed up. He has lifesteal and shoots some enemies to regain health. Or say he has 5 pots and makes his health regen go up a lot. Each of these would cease the passive. So, if they were to be gaining more HP back each second than his passive was giving off, it would seem as if it wasn't even there and their health regen was just worsened for 6 or so seconds.
Also you need to count that some stacks will end quicker so the dot will weaken a bit with time.
